x_symbol.name: xHasPoint
x_symbol.description: Determines if an element contains an absolute point. The element's boundary is extended (negative clip), or contracted (positive clip) by the clipping parameters.
x_symbol.syntax: xHasPoint(ele, iLeft, iTop[, iClpT[, iClpR[, iClpB[, iClpL]]]])

par.name: ele
par.note: An ID string or object reference.

par.name: iClpT
par.note: Clip top. If not of type 'number' (if only 3 arguments) then t=r=b=l=0;

par.name: iClpR
par.note: Clip right. If not of type 'number' (if only 4 arguments) then r=b=l=t;

par.name: iClpB
par.note: Clip bottom. If not of type 'number' (if only 5 arguments) then l=r; b=t;

x_symbol.return: True if iLeft,iTop is contained within the clipped area of ele.

rev.author: mf
rev.note: put in it's own file for use with XC
